definitions.definition: The study of historical geography — of the (chiefly physical, but sometimes political/cultural) geography of the world in the geologic past.

subdefinitions.definition: Synonym of paleogeomorphology The study of the physical geography from the past; no political or cultural history

main_definition: The study of historical geography — of the (chiefly physical, but sometimes political/cultural) geography of the world in the geologic past.
